```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)
```


```{r}
library(tidyverse)
```
Read kaggle_train

```{r}
kaggle_train <- read.csv("train_kaggle.csv", header = TRUE)
```


We use kaggle_train as a source for all subsets that we produce here

```{r}
# Set a seed for reproducibility (optional but recommended)

# Sample 4000 rows for sample_kaggle_valid from kaggle_train
sample_kaggle_valid <- kaggle_train[sample(nrow(kaggle_train), 4000), ]

# Remove the sampled rows from kaggle_train
sample_kaggle_train <- kaggle_train[!(rownames(kaggle_train) %in% rownames(sample_kaggle_valid)), ]


# Write the data frames to CSV files in your working directory
write.csv(sample_kaggle_valid, "sample_kaggle_valid.csv", row.names = FALSE)
write.csv(sample_kaggle_train, "sample_kaggle_train.csv", row.names = FALSE)
```
